summary: The Stand Strong Falls Prevention Act aims to amend the Older Americans Act of 1965 to improve falls prevention research and activities. The bill establishes an Advisory Committee on Falls Prevention to develop a national plan, assess existing federal efforts, and make recommendations. The committee will include representatives from various federal agencies and experts. The bill mandates regular reports to Congress on falls prevention progress and outcomes, including recommendations for pilot programs and expanded initiatives. The bill also authorizes appropriations for falls prevention efforts and defines "falls prevention."
